title: How to Make Sprinkle Encrusted Chocolate

steps.headline: Set up the double boiler for use.
steps.description: Put out the silicone chocolate molds in readiness for adding the sprinkles and melted chocolate. Arrange them on a cookie sheet or similar, for ease of keeping together.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate in the double boiler.
steps.description: Heat gently until it is soft, with no chunks, and take care not to burn it.

steps.headline: Prepare the silicone chocolate mold cases.
steps.description: While the chocolate is melting, pour sufficient sprinkles into the mold to cover the base of each mold.

steps.headline: Pour the warm and melted chocolate over the top of the sprinkles in the molds.
Wait until the chocolate has cooled.
steps.description: You may put it in the fridge, then take the chocolates out of the molds.

steps.headline: Eat with the sprinkles facing on top of the chocolate.
steps.description: Or, eat with them on the bottom; it's not our place tell you how to eat these!

steps.headline: Prepare a resting stage for the dipped balloons.
steps.description: Lay a sheet of wax paper or parchment paper across a baking sheet. You'll need about two to three sheets minimum.

steps.headline: Pour the white chocolate melts into a double boiler.
steps.description: Melt over gentle heat. Alternatively, you can melt the chocolate in a microwave. Use a microwave-safe bowl.

steps.headline: Blow up four to six balloons.
steps.description: Blow them to the size of the bowls you want. You could even vary the sizes if that suits your purposes. Do not over blow the balloon.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into a wide bowl.
steps.description: The bowl needs to be wide enough for you to dip the balloons into.

steps.headline: Dip a balloon into the melted chocolate.
steps.description: Dip it to around one third or a quarter of the way up. Eyeball it to get the size of bowl you're after.

steps.headline: Pull out of the chocolate.
steps.description: Quickly dip the chocolate coated part of the balloon into the sprinkles. Lift and turn to cover all areas of the melted chocolate completely in sprinkles.

steps.headline: Lay down the covered balloon on the prepared wax paper.
steps.description: Place the balloon into the refrigerator. Let it chill for five minutes. You can also just set the balloon aside if the room is cool enough and let it set at room temperature.

steps.headline: Repeat for the remaining sprinkle-encrusted bowls you'd like to make.
Prepare the bowls.
steps.description: To complete the bowls, use the end of the scissors to poke a small hole into the balloon and let the air out slowly. For the part affixed to the chocolate, peel this away with care, to reveal the chocolate bowl.

steps.headline: Fill the chocolate bowls with sweet treats.
steps.description: You could even add the chocolates made in Method 1! Or, fill it with scoops of your favorite ice cream.

text: Sprinkle encrusted chocolates Set up the double boiler for use. Put out the silicone chocolate molds in readiness for adding the sprinkles and melted chocolate. Arrange them on a cookie sheet or similar, for ease of keeping together. Melt the chocolate in the double boiler. Heat gently until it is soft, with no chunks, and take care not to burn it. Prepare the silicone chocolate mold cases. While the chocolate is melting, pour sufficient sprinkles into the mold to cover the base of each mold. Pour the warm and melted chocolate over the top of the sprinkles in the molds.  Wait until the chocolate has cooled. You may put it in the fridge, then take the chocolates out of the molds. Eat with the sprinkles facing on top of the chocolate. Or, eat with them on the bottom; it's not our place tell you how to eat these! Finished. Make some more––they're so delicious. Sprinkle Encrusted Chocolate Bowl Prepare a resting stage for the dipped balloons. Lay a sheet of wax paper or parchment paper across a baking sheet. You'll need about two to three sheets minimum. Pour the white chocolate melts into a double boiler. Melt over gentle heat. Alternatively, you can melt the chocolate in a microwave. Use a microwave-safe bowl. Blow up four to six balloons. Blow them to the size of the bowls you want. You could even vary the sizes if that suits your purposes. Do not over blow the balloon. Pour the melted chocolate into a wide bowl. The bowl needs to be wide enough for you to dip the balloons into. Dip a balloon into the melted chocolate. Dip it to around one third or a quarter of the way up. Eyeball it to get the size of bowl you're after. Pull out of the chocolate. Quickly dip the chocolate coated part of the balloon into the sprinkles. Lift and turn to cover all areas of the melted chocolate completely in sprinkles. Lay down the covered balloon on the prepared wax paper. Place the balloon into the refrigerator. Let it chill for five minutes. You can also just set the balloon aside if the room is cool enough and let it set at room temperature. Repeat for the remaining sprinkle-encrusted bowls you'd like to make.  Prepare the bowls. To complete the bowls, use the end of the scissors to poke a small hole into the balloon and let the air out slowly. For the part affixed to the chocolate, peel this away with care, to reveal the chocolate bowl. Fill the chocolate bowls with sweet treats. You could even add the chocolates made in Method 1! Or, fill it with scoops of your favorite ice cream.
